definition: Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
surname Luo/old name of several rivers (in Henan, Shaanxi, Sichuan and Anhui)
to cut down/to fell/to dispatch an expedition against/to attack/to boast/Taiwan pr. [fa1]
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

pinyin: Jie2 ke4 Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4

sentences.chinese: 斯洛伐克碾核樂隊流產。

sentences.english: Lowlands are found in the southwestern along the Danube river and southeastern parts of Slovakia.
sentences.chinese: 斯洛伐克的低地地形主要沿着多瑙河分佈和在東南部。

sentences.english: The Slovakian parliament has just voted this down, although it is likely to accept it in the end.
sentences.chinese: 斯洛伐克議會投了反對票，但接受似乎只是時間問題。

sentences.english: It was the centre of Samo"s empire in the 7th century.
sentences.chinese: 7世紀時，斯洛伐克成爲薩莫帝國的中心。

sentences.english: This weekend the World Dog Show is taking place in Bratislava, Slovakia.
sentences.chinese: 本週末，世界狗展在斯洛伐克布拉迪斯拉發舉行。

sentences.english: The Slovaks had their full independence guaranteed by Germany.
sentences.chinese: 斯洛伐克的完全獨立得到了德國的保證。

sentences.english: She was also busy giving medical care to Hungarian and Slovak peasants.
sentences.chinese: 她也忙於匈牙利和斯洛伐克農民的醫療保健。

sentences.english: The Slovak constitution guarantees freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 斯洛伐克憲法規定宗教自由。

sentences.english: This 24-year-old tennis player was born in Slovakia.
sentences.chinese: 這位24歲的網球名將生在斯洛伐克。

definition: Moldova/Republic of Moldova, former Soviet republic on the border with Romania
